raw_comment:
1. I noticed that legacy applicants had a higher chance of getting accepted. I also noticed that the rate stayed consistent almost all the way until the 50-ish mark.
2. I wonder why there is a dip in the estimated legacy boost between the 75th - 90th percentile. I also wonder why the rates boosted up so suddenly after the 50th percentile.
3. This is relevant to me and my community because soon we will be looking to apply at colleges. Will this impact what schools we consider applying to just because we are scared of rejection?
4. Are College Admissions Considering Wealth Over Grades and Work Ethic?
ace_sentences: Legacy applicants have a higher chance of acceptance.
The acceptance rate for legacy applicants stays consistent almost until the 50th percentile.
There is a dip in the estimated legacy boost between the 75th percentile and the 90th percentile.
I wonder why there is a dip in the estimated legacy boost between the 75th percentile and the 90th percentile.
The estimated legacy boost increases suddenly after the 50th percentile.
I wonder why the estimated legacy boost increases suddenly after the 50th percentile.
This topic is relevant to me.
This topic is relevant to my community.
Soon we will apply to colleges.
This topic may impact which schools we consider.
We may avoid some schools because we fear rejection.
The headline is: Are college admissions considering wealth over grades and work ethic?
